result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon Thomas Moczynski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Concurrent with: any other sentence

Financial obligations imposed in 22CM656 shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision in 21CF145.  lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant Jon Thomas Moczynski in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Jon Thomas Moczynski.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  On a plea to Ct 1 and 2, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct 3; Court questions defendant; Guilty plea entered on Ct 1 and 2; Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and 2, on motion of the State Ct 3 is dismissed for read in.  Court enters a judgment of conviction and defendant is sentenced.  Victim makes statements.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jon Thomas Moczynski in court in custody and by Attorney Timothy Drewa.  Counsel's first appearance. Pretrial held.  Joint request to adjourn case to tag along with sentencing after revocation (21CF145) on September 28th.  Not guilty pleas entered by Court.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran via video. Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender. Not guilty plea entered by Court. $750 cash bail set.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
